answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Therapy for aortic regurgitation is with medications, if not controlled with this surgical therapy is planned. Surgical therapy for aortic regurgitation is based on the clinical symptoms, left ventricular dilatation  and Ejection fraction. The ejection fraction is a useful measure of left ventricular performance. The normal range is 63-77% for males and 55-75% for females. It reflects the pumping capacity of the heart. Left ventricular dilatation may be present. Next we should check to rule out if there is decreasing exercise tolerance on exercise stress testing. Based on the collective data therapy can be planned.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: My Father ,74 years age, a known patient of diabetes , hypertention ,was diaganosed with 3vd(3 vessel disease ) about two years ago and had cabag(open heart surgery) , he is feeling ok , other than palpitations and heart murmering during exertion or in rest some times.He  had echo,ultrasound,holter, tests during last one month , the reason for that was palpitation , mumuring sound  of  heart , (the reports are in my photos portion , and viewable) , Today cardiologist gave opinion that there is heart valve leakage(valve regurgitation) , as some layer /scaling is shown below the heart surface. According to doc they will not do anything before one year , and only medications are sufficent. Medication he is taking after Cabag is Cavidalol 6.25 , Simvastatin(Zocor) and diabetese & hypertension medicines.I would like to ask what we should do further , and what should be his future plan to avoid /repair /treat this .
title: Valve Leakage(Valve Regurgitation)
